description:
This place is close to heaven on earth. Their pizza is always exactly what you need. You can never go wrong with a slice of cheese. The people who work there are so nice and always play the best music. 
One exception: They recently changed their ranch recipe and it's the worst!!! Soo herbalicious and gross. Save yourself and do not get ranch. 
Also, @hole in the wall, please change back your ranch
author: Zoya P.

description:
On the way home from work, the roommate and I decided to get pizza for dinner. We placed a delivery order through DoorDash on Monday, September 10th at 5:53pm. It arrived at 6:47pm. We live in Outer Richmond.

*Traditional Wings: 1/2 lb, Buffalo ($8)
*Mixed Greens: Lettuce, red onions, tomatoes and no black olives, Caesar ($8)
*Pizza By The Slice ($3.25): Chicken Pesto ($0.75)
*Combo Classic Pizza: Marinara, salami, pepperoni, mushrooms, sweet green bell pepper, red onions and Italian sausage, Medium 14" Pizzas ($27)

The roomie picked the combo pizza. It was a decent combination pizza. Good assortment of ingredients. I did like that the crust was on the thinner side, but it was still a touch too bready for me. Though it did have a nice chew. I adore pesto, so I'm glad they offer slices here. The chicken pesto slice was a good size and fulfilled my need for variety. The wings were okay. The buffalo sauce was too tangy, so we actually had the wings naked. I'm glad they came with celery as I adore my veggies. The roommate's kinda on a diet, so he wanted me to get a salad. This wasn't really a mixed green salad as it only came with romaine, but since we got caesar dressing, it was fine.

All right spot to grab some pizza. I am glad they offer slices, as I always want a tomato based and a pesto based pie. This way, I didn't have to order a whole new pizza. Overall, A-OK.
author: Elena N.

description:
Amidst the late night trance music sits the worst version of cardboard pizza I've ever tasted. Ugh. 
I hate blowing up spots with a 1 star review because I I love the entrepreneurial spirit but, sometimes this has to be done.

I'll never understand the lack of late night food in San Francisco but, there has to be some sort of middle ground...right?! When establishments can get away with serving patrons less than mediocre slices of pizza at all hours of the day it makes me wonder why this city can't get its act together. I understand there's a need for the late night hunger fix but, it's got to stop. 

Factory dough, sub par sauce and cheep cheese make this a hard pass of a visit. One bite of one slice and the rest was given to the next guy in line because I couldn't do it anymore. 

Hard pass.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
I guess I've learned my lesson. Don't order things other than pizza from places like this unless well recommended. 

Meatball sandwich- flavor 7/10. Portion size 8/10. Bread 0/10 completely burnt. A meatball sandwich is hard to mess up, but completely scorching the bread is a sure fire way to jack it up. Gross burnt taste.

Wings- flavor 4/10. Wing size 8/10. Temperature 0/10. Not even warm. 0-2 hole in the wall.

Fries- flavor 2/10. Temperature 1/10. Luke warm. Tasted old and hard, not soft and hot. 

Wouldn't return or order from again.
author: Cole G.

description:
Bottom line: Only place in this area for a quick pizza slice

Context: Visited many times, only ever gotten pizza slices

Food: Big slices, crispy bottom, kind of a thick crust. I am okay with the pizza, especially when it's late at night and you want nothing else but a combo slice! My boyfriend is from NJ, pretty opinionated about pizza, and he doesn't like the pizza from here. However he will eat it, because it's the only place around for quick, individual slices.

Environment: Tiny place, cool vibe with pictures all over the wall, stools on one side

Service: Always friendly
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Got into town at close to midnight and this was the only place within walking distance for food.  Called in my order, it was ready when I got there (15 minutes like the guy in the phone said), and the large pizza was perfect for the 5 adults and 1 kids in our group.  I would recommend and will be ordering again while we're here.
author: Howard C.

description: One of the biggest pizzas I have ever had delivered! I had high expectations as this place was recommended to me. Unfortunately, the pizza was a little bland but the base/crust was perfect. It was a little pricey but I'd happily try a different pizza next time.
author: Simon Y.

description: Yes, this place does fit the definition of a hole-in-the-wall, but it's definitely not in alignment with the typically connotation that hole-in-wall places are good. Honestly, they're just pizza producers (and it's not even that good) in it for the cash. I believe they are trying to capitalize off the app-enabled food delivery market. I mean if you're a rut for a slice, on the brink of death, and this place is right in front of you, then it's not a bad idea to check out. Otherwise, steer clear and go to North Beach or something.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Not bad. It's ok, kind of expensive, like all pizza places around here... but I don't really remember what it tasted like.

It's ok if you NEED pizza and are in the area. Friendly staff.
author: Auza A.

description:
I contacted SF Hole in the Wall Pizza for their catering. The menu was very extensive and perfect for our party of 80 guests. Sahar was very responsive and helpful with our order. It was great to have an option for for the picky eaters (kids)!  
 
The food arrive right on time and displayed nicely. Food was hot and so delicious!! The lamb kabobs, rice, grilled veggies, dipping sauces, chicken kabobs, pita, tabbouleh -- all yummy and flavorful! We had many guests asking about the food because it was so good. 

Both Sahar and her husband could not have been more delightful to work with! We definitely recommend their catering services.
author: K G.

description: Does all your pizza arrive cold? I ordered the chicken pesto and combo slices and they were all cold. Ranch was good. Now I have heartburn over cold mediocre pizza. You let me down SF Hole In The Wall
author: Natalie R.

description: FN AMAZING! My fav pizza spot in the city. I've been here 3 nights in a row since an Uber delivery order a few nights ago. Love these guys
author: Sodro K.

description:
Got here late to a mistakenly canceled Air BnB reservation in SF to find a quick hotel and my gf and I were starving .

All places were closed as it's almost 1am but we are stressed tired from traveling from Hurricane Irma and hangry.

We were greeted with smiles and friendly ppl.
A woman sitting st the front suggested the ranch with the Pesto Chick was great. So we did , with a cheese and another pepperoni. 
Delicious!

Highly suggest it based on the great customer service and the tasty food.
author: Cesar C.

description:
I love this place for the ambiance but not for the pizza. The coolest little hole in the wall... but it doesn't feel like it because as you enter there are big mirrors on the whole right hand side of the wall. Above way up high tons of baseball caps work well as decoration. I noticed train tracks above too... Not running at the moment but in this place's heyday no doubt there was a train moving about way up there. On the left are signed celebrity photos. The whole place is cool beyond words. Its all stuffed into the smallest storefront imaginable. Its the width of a door and 3 more feet for the counter where the bar stools are.

Now for the pizza. I had high hopes. Although I had a slice, which usually means old and sitting out for 30 minutes or maybe even hours... I had the good fortune to arrive after a new pizza came out of the oven. Half cheese and half pepperoni. I choose cheese only as I'm currently comparison tasting as many of the pizza by the slice places as I can in the city. I'm on a real mission. Each place I go to I try to just get cheese to minimize variables.

So $3.26 later I get it... uggghhh. I bite in and its more greasy than I would like and the bottom is way too chewy. No crunch. Sadly I've had better frozen pizzas. I really don't understand it. How could this happen to a fresh pizza? Probably I will go back just to confirm. I really want to like this place. They do have other options other than pizza. I strongly suggest you try those other options. Your not missing much with a cheese pizza.

For the record my favorite pizza by the slice is Golden Boy if you like a thick crust and Pizzelle Di North Beach if you like a thin crust. But my study isn't finished yet. I've yet to try many of the popular pizza places around. For the record Firetrail is awesome with bubbly crust but it doesn't fall in the category of late night by the slice places.

BTW what kind of crazy price is $3.26??? Why not change it to $3.25!! or $3.50??
author: Stefan T.

description: Least expensive, quickest place in the marina and it's open past midnight. In a neighborhood where eggs and toast costs $12 this place is heaven sent.
author: Yup R.

description:
Terrible experience. I'll preface this by saying I don't expect much from a sliced pizza joint and I never write reviews, good or bad, but the service here was terrible. 

I walked up and said hello to the employee, but she had to finish her text before greeting me. She looked annoyed from the start. Then I handed her my card to pay and when she was done she threw it on the counter instead of handing back to me. When I was handed my food she had a look as if she was bothered and annoyed. Finally, when I opened the box, the pizza was still cold. 

Some of this may seem trivial, but overall her attitude just sucked. 

Again, I don't expect a whole lot when ordering a single slice of pizza, but this was enough to find somewhere else to go.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
We all live a fast paced lifestyle. And getting our food quick and on-the-go is key on many occasions. This takes us to the trendy Marina District in San Francisco where you will find "SF Hole In The Wall Pizza". Conveniently located on Scott St. and in between Chestnut and Lombard St's., this place has been feeding hungry patrons of every lifestyle since 2012.

I actually stumbled on this place by accident and that was simply walking by (without using the Yelp app on my smartphone). Now that doesn't very often anymore! Reason being is that I needed a quick bite to eat while my lady was getting her hair and nails done. Not to mention, I had already chugged down a few beers at a local sports bar which gave me the munchies after consuming alcoholic beverages.

Now keep in mind, this place literally is a hole-in-the-wall. There is no seating inside but it does offer a few tables and chairs outside. You mainly have to have the mindset that your food will be to-go. Going back to the interior layout of this place.. It is very small but there is enough room to view the menu; one of my gripes is how difficult the menu is to read. There is also a wide array of autographed pictures (which includes the late Robin Williams and others) on the left hand side. You can also see how the kitchen is in the rear of the building. With as tiny as this place is, I am almost thinking that this entire business is only about 400 square feet.

Onto the food; their pizza selections are actually quite extensive. You will find your standard cheese, pepperoni, combination, and vegetarian. And several other creations such as the Margherita, Chicken Pesto, BBQ Chicken and the Pizza Aloha. If pizza isn't your thing, they also serve calzones, burgers, wings, fries, meatballs, sandwiches, and salads. And for refreshments, they have fountain drinks as well as bottled beer. I ended up ordering a slice of their "Chicken Pesto" which came to a little over $5.00.

I do like how they put the pizza in a nice little box to fit their New York-styled slice. As far as the taste, I think it was just average at best. I had very little chicken on my pizza and the taste of the basil in the pesto was very subtle. It almost just tasted like a standard cheese slice. Fortunately I was able to dress it up by adding crushed red pepper but that didn't really do much. I suppose if you were extremely drunk, this would taste amazing. But even after drinking three beers, the pizza just wasn't all that.

I do think a place like this will do just fine; simply because its in the heart of the Marina District and also because the shopping in this part of town is thriving. Not to mention, prices on their food is dirt cheap which is all the more reason to get filled up for just a few bucks. Overall, I don't think I will come back to "SF Hole in the Wall Pizza". But if you're a pizza lover, I would still consider checking this place out.
author: Donovan H.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for awhile, since I love NY style pizza  and holes in the wall. SF Hole In The Wall Pizza is aptly named - it's literally a hole in the wall that sells pizza (as well as burgers and a few other things). There's a small counter with a few stools to sit, and there are a few tables on the sidewalk, but I think they belong to the restaurant next door.

The young woman behind the counter was very friendly and described the various slices she had behind the counter. I ordered the combo slice and a bottle of water for $7. My expectations weren't too high after looking at the pizzas - the crust looked pretty thick, but after she heated up my slice, it was nice and surprisingly crisp. The toppings were OK, however the sausage was pretty disappointing - it tasted like the type of sausage you get on a frozen pizza - not proper Italian sausage.

I would give the pizza a solid 3.5 stars, however my experience was severely downgraded because some homeless/crazy/drugged out guy staggered in while I was trying to eat my pizza and kind of ruined the experience. It's not their fault, but that's just how it is.

Afterwards, I walked a few blocks over to Pizza Avellino to compare their NYC slice with Hole in the Wall, and I have to say that Avellino was a few notches better.
author: Allen T.

description: $5.50 for a combo pizza slice. I can buy entire frozen pizza like Digiorno's for that price AND it'd be much better. Seriously,  I eat Digiorno's all the time. Pizza at this place is mediocre, doesn't taste like anything really. Skip it!
author: Vol T.

description: The calzone was disgusting, no mozarella. They forgot a whole cheese pizza. Do not order from them!!
author: Christophe B.

description:
Fantastic pizza! Everything is made from scratch. Although they only deliver within 3 miles from their location. I hear it is because they want to keep the quality of their pizza high. Makes sense. Anyways, as a local San Franciscan, this is one of my absolute favorite place to get a ZA. Also, the slices are the best value anywhere in the Marina, no, the entire San Francisco. Try it or diet my friends.

-wifive-
author: simon k.

description: When you're in the marina and you want a slice without breaking the bank the hole in the wall is your best call. Authentic Italian style slices.
author: CT P.

description: The best cheese pizza I've ever had! And their homemade ranch dressing is amazing. I may be going there every night while I'm in town!
author: Stacy L.

description: Best pizza by the slice. Always fresh and hot this pizza reminds me of the closest thing when craving a NY slice.
author: Lauryn H.

description: Used to visit SF from Stanford just for the buffalo cauliflower here. They've stopped serving it. Can't get in anywhere else. As a vegetarian, it's very upsetting.
author: Victoria P.

description:
there's a place in the marina where the nekkid pizzas dancarina
there's a Hole In The Wall where dem foodies can eat it all

(oh as we climb to new pinnacles of maturity...)

nbtrly speaking of naked, this morning i realized y'all are preoccupied with dropping grannypannys whereas i've already eaten my way through the places that'll drop entire OUTFITS. #upsnap #downsnap #sideto #sidesnap beezys and #yesyouheardatleasttwoofthoseslangherefirst.

this place don't drop but i was talking in general.

(^_^) Boneless Wings
sauced up chicken nuggets. #nugglife

(^_^) Tipsy Suzy
thick crust or gtho. #twss

if they ever expand their delivery radius, i'd order from here again. for now my only way is via a 3rd-party courier = nvm. #firstfoodproblems
author: Dan B.

description: Best pizza by the slice you can find in this area, hands down. They have a lot of other things to eat besides pizza like burgers and fries, but I have no reason to try anything else when the their pizza is so good.
author: Luis M.

description:
On a delightfully gloomy day, I made my way to what truly is a hole in the wall--nestled right in between two other eateries in a clean, mid to upscale neighborhood in The City.  

I walk in and take in all the decor--photos of Robin Williams, babes in swimsuits, and patrons of the past hanging on the walls.  Above me is a train set.  I am cheerily greeted by a cute cashier with a super-friendly disposition and killer eyelashes.  

I order a slice of the No-Hangover Aloha Pizza and the Bacon & Cheese fries.  The cashier suggests I get the lunch special which is a can of soda to go w/ the pizza .  My total comes to only $11.  

Not only is my food good, but the service was sincere and helped to make for a great grey day in San Francisco!
author: Amanda M.

description:
a cool place for New York style pizza. not a chain not a conglomerate just a small business and I like it. the interior was interesting just like the city is. Robin Williams movie posters and autograph all over the wall. Robin is one of my favorite actors. 

I ordered a calzone with bacon and chicken filling and a side of ranch dressing. The calzone was 9 dollars and a side of ranch was 75 cents I believe. the Calzone was made to order it was ample food for lunch and freshly made. tasted great. will have it again no doubt about it. 

They also have pizza by the slice if you need something quick and tasty.

great price for the quality of food and location. the place was clean and well maintained.
author: Suresh D.

description: Very simple cheese pizza, which is how I like it.  Quick order while waiting.  Close walk to our hotel.  Would definitely recommend.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Hole in the Wall Pizza is my go-to spot in the city when I want a slice of pizza. My friend who lives in SF actually introduced me to the place a few years ago and I've been going back ever since. I usually go there at night and it's usually not busy. It's literally a hole in the wall. It is really small inside. It probably could only fit 10 people comfortably in their little dining/order area. They have a few bar seats inside but that's pretty much it. It's a good place to grab pizza and go. They have a lot on their menu but I've only tried a few of their pizzas and their garlic fries. I highly recommend their chicken pesto pizza and their combo pizza. Their slices are a good size. Some people may consider them big slices. I can only eat 1 and I'll be stuffed. If you are a garlic fries lover, I don't recommend their garlic fries unless you like your garliac fries to completely smothered in garic. The staff is friendly and service is quick. Their pizza by the slice is already made and chillin. They warm it up for you and put it in the box then you can be on your way or if you can grab a seat, enjoy your slice inside. Like most places in SF, parking is limited so you might end up parking a couple blocks away and walking. I will continue to stop here when I'm in need of a pizza fix in SF.
author: Misty T.

description:
Ordered takeout from this place since it was pretty late at night and I saw that they were still open and had better reviews than the other pizza joints who were also still open.

Ordered a slice of pizza with a few toppings, but then got the slice and it had completely different toppings on it. Not sure if that was the restaurants fault, or the delivery app's fault, but I gave the slice to my roommate since the pizza was not what I had ordered and he said it was delicious! The slice was HUGE compared to most pizza places and they pile on the toppings pretty high which was a plus. He loved it!

I also ordered their Garlic Bread which came with about 10 pieces. It was loaded with garlic and cheese! Very yummy. However, I asked for an extra side of marinara sauce and instead, received an extra side of ketchup. 

Also ordered their onion rings which was the best part of the order since it was the only one that didn't get messed up. The portion size was big, so it was perfect for sharing! The batter they used was also pretty thick and the onion rings were perfectly crunchy! We also got a side of their homemade ranch for dipping.

All in all, the food was really good. The only let down was that the order was incorrect in terms of the pizza toppings, and receiving a side of ketchup instead of marinara sauce. Again, not sure if that's the restaurant's fault or the delivery app. But the food was good so I'd be willing to give them another chance.
author: Chisholm T.

description: Great place to grab a slice of good pizza after hours, fast and efficient. Usually a number of different choices available, short wait while your slice is reheated.
author: John N.

description: They recently raised their prices, it now super overpriced for the quality of food, poor value.
author: Joshua L.

description: Amazing customer service! Pizza taste very delicious! Girl in the front who charges was very sweet and pricing is cheap for a huge slice you get! Worked near by and it was very convenient! Differently going to come back :)
author: Ziada J.

description: Good pizza, but a bit pricey.  Literally this place is really a hole in the wall.  Three stars for accuracy on the time for picking up your pizza.
author: Mike W.

description: Charged me 80 cents for a side of ranch. I only go here bc it's open late and it's food is mediocre and I'm usually too tired to deal.
author: Danielle R.

description: Our go to order and delivery for our family.  Great pizza and boneless wings (that alone is 5 stars!). Consistently great.  Food delivery always great - speedy even on weekends.
author: stephany m.

description:
Took nearly 2 hours to get my order. When I brought it up when I called there was no offer to reimburse or do anything. Awful. 

Ordered from here a lot and the service has continued to go down. Thinking I'll find somewhere else to go.
author: Travis C.

description:
I ordered pizza at midnight from this establishment. Forty-five minutes later I heard a knock at my hotel room. The pizza man was there with my pizza, soda, and dips. 

The pizza was perfectly toasted, the ingredients were fresh and crisp.
author: Marcela S.

description: **First timer *** I had one of the worse experiences at this "hole on the Wall" shop . I decided to try it , I noticed they serve burgers , wanting to try something new ; from going to superDuper every other day . I order my burger and fries . Waited close to 20mins before I followed up about my order to go . I get my order ,noticed the fries are well over soggy , almost as if they were just re-microwaved , I even had my employee try some to get a 2nd opinion . I called the place and the guy completely told me off and gave me the boot . I paid under $11 . For $10 I could have gotten me a well cooked and juicy burger with fresh cooked fries from SUPER DUPER . ... sooooo disappointed . Never coming Back !
author: Joseph Z.

description:
Was craving for a pizza and and since i didnt buy a whole pizza so decided to come here since this is the only i know that close enough that enough to my workplace that does pizza by slice. This place is pretty but have seatings for those who want to dine in.

When i first walk in, there wasn't no one at the front/cashier until someone came in and walk to the back telling cashier person that i was waiting. But their service was quick if you just want the pizza by slice and if it isnt busy.

I got the combo which cost $4.26. Okay price but the slice they gave me was pretty big. They warm the pizza for you before they give your pizza. Their pizza was not bad. It was crispy at the crust. The pizza kinda got warm fast by the time i walk back to my workplace even though they put the pizza in the oven. Will come back if i want something quick for lunch
author: Julie N.

description: Had a slice.  Meh...Its ok.   As the name implies it's a whole in the wall but not in the legendary way
author: Spanky M.

description:
As a first timer, I wasn't impressed. A few friends and so were having adult beverages across the way when the bartender recommended that place and said we could bring the food inside...score! So I mosey on over so we could enjoy some food. 

I ordered what was though to be a pre-made pizza slice and french fries, but for some reason that order took 35 minutes to reach my hands. I wonder if it has anything to do with the Indian girl working behind the counter taking multiple selfies with pizza slices as her background. I interrupted her photo shoot to ask if she forgot my order, but she said no. However, two seconds later she bolts towards the back and mumbled something to someone in the back (probably about my missing order) and now another 15 minutes have passed...so a total of 35 minutes of my life are gone in a fast food establishment the size of a bathroom without any other customers while having to witness the girl who thinks she's going to be instafamous with her pizza background. 

Finally I receive my order and the fries were soggy and overly saturated in oil. To top off the night he food caused me to purchase Imodium AD. I don't know what I've done in my previous life, but I am truly sorry universe.
author: Victoria S.

description: I mean, what can you say except for when you're wasted this pizza is top notch. Great selection, fast service, inexpensive, more than edible.
author: Elliott W.

description:
Unfortunately I don't have a lot of good things to say about this place.  Delivery to 1 block away took 90 minutes (20 minutes past the already delayed delivery estimate provided by eat24).

When the food did finally arrive, our pizza was missing 1 of our 3 toppings (we ordered a 3-topping deal being offered on eat24).  The pizza was mediocre, edible but not great.  Probably would not order it again.

The other sides we ordered ranged from good to completely inedible and disgusting.  Starting with the best: the no hangover fries - considering we had been day drinking, I thought these fries would be a good idea, and they were.  They were cheesy, bacon-y, and spicy.  The fries themselves were soggy, but it was definitely my favorite item in our order.
Mediocre - The hand made boneless wings.  I personally did not like these at all, but other people in my group enjoyed them.  They did arrive completely soggy, which was a turn off. Only got these because they were part of the 3-topping pizza deal.  Would not personally order again.
Bad - Cheesy garlic bread.  Everyone in our group agreed it was horrible and inedible.  Had an oddly sweet-chemically taste.  Not sure how or why it tasted so bad but I've honestly never tasted anything like it.  Took one bite and tossed it.
author: Sam L.

description: I visited this pizza place when I was playing tourist in SF. It's cheap and it's soooo good I normally don't like wings but these wings were delicious.
author: Kristen M.

description: 4 stars for the pizza that is delivered to my house.  2 stars for walk-in pizza by the slice.  What is the difference??  I guess the difference is in freshness?
author: Chloe M.

description: I was looking for something open in sf while I was driving for uber late at night and this little gem pop up and I'm so glad it did garlic pesto chicken pizza was delicious!!!
author: Ashley A.

description:
They have a whole wall dedicated to robin Williams!!

Some friends and I came here after a night of drinking and it was exactly what we needed. The cashier was so friendly and accommodating - he gave us Oreos while we waited for our pizza to cook! There's definitely a cozy, homey vibe to this neighborhood hole in the wall pizzeria which we loved.
author: Natalie P.

description: Traveling for work and looked up closest pizza delivery! Faster than expected and delicious
author: Megan C.

description: I'm from NYC I know a thing or two about pizza. Lol it was delicious and the place is so cool and clean. The service was amazing. Great place
author: Peter V.

description:
We ordered for delivery last night "home made boneless wings"   french fries and salads, they arrived after more than 90 minutes greasy, oily and cold! Needless to say the food was terrible! The restaurant called after 30 minutes from confirming the order claiming that the address was entered wrong and they do not deliver to that address, while the address was very clear and within their delivery zone! They said it would take 30 minutes to get here and instead took more than an hour. The homemade boneless wings were a joke! They looked more like frozen chicken tenders. The fries were greasy and looked like they were deep fried in bad oil!
The food went straight to the trash, and the restaurant had no hesitation to refuse a refund! Bad service, and not worth the money.
author: Husam H.

description:
Good pizza, friendly staff.
We got there late at night and were served well with delicious pizza.
author: Moslem L.

description: Great place for a late bite. Was walking around at 10:30 after doing an escape the room at the Palace. Everything was closed, I thought this wa the city, anyway. Found this place and our group of 9 all go slices and waters. Everyone left satisfied. They had 10 different pizzas to choose from. For a by the slice joint, pizza was good!
author: Michael F.

description: Very good pepperoni pizza in the Marina. Always will be back if I'm in the area. Great way to feed the beast after a night of libations.
author: Dan M.

description: Very good and will go back.  Small place but they know what they are doing. Take your love there and enjoy the pizza and the city
author: TomKat P.

description: This review is specifically for the Spinach Calzone. The ingredients are stated as: Spinach, Mozzarella, and Ricotta. What they don't tell you is that they dump 5 cups of pepper in the calzone. You can't taste anything but pepper! Note to restaurant: please tell people that this has so much pepper so that they know what they're getting themselves into!
author: Georgina D.

description:
4.8 stars. Couldn't have asked for a better meal--especially late night in SF. Using EAT24 (great app), I ordered a large pizza with mushrooms and pepperoni, the french fries tossed in garlic, and the boneless buffalo wings with ranch. UM OH MY GOD. Everything was so good. Plus tip, it was $42--A STEAL in any city, but especially in SF!!! I can see how the pizza crust is not really for everyone. It's what I would describe as a "thinner Chicago style crust," if you can imagine. I personally loved it. My boyfriend prefers NY style pizza, but he still greatly enjoyed this pizza, so I think it should be good for thin-crust lovers as well who aren't overly picky. The buffalo wings had an amazing breading with a texture and taste I've never experienced before. And the garlic fries were thin cut (my fav) and toasted with a metric TON of roasted minced garlic. The servings were so huge too. One order of buffalo wings could easily serve as a generous appetizer for 4-5 people. Same with the garlic fries. Absolutely divine. I will be going literally no where else for late night SF pizza ever again.

0.2 stars was docked because of the delivery time. I was quoted 30-40 minutes by EAT24, but it ended up taking about an hour. I received a text message from EAT24 saying the restaurant was particularly busy and quoted me for it's arrival to be around 12:15am. (I had ordered around 11pm.) So, it was nice that I got a head's up and knew to expect a delay. Bonus points to Hole in the Wall because it was delivered with a pleasant and enthusiastic smile right around midnight. According to other reviews, delivery is usually pretty fast, so I'm guessing this was just a bit of an off or understaffed night. Definitely worth the wait. It's places like this that give SF it's glowing culinary reputation.
author: Lauren C.

description:
This place left me with a great first impression when I tried it shortly after moving to SF, but has consistently disappointed me ever since. I've only ordered delivery from here, always through Eat24, and while initially I thought this place was excellent, the food quality quickly took a nosedive. The burgers are reliably charred to the point where they resemble bricks made out of carbon more than beef, and the various cheesy fries (once a favorite of mine) have become sad, soggy, and stale. 

To add insult to injury, every single time minus the first time, the food was delivered at least an hour late, and this is beyond the Eat24 delivery extension.  I am very hesitant about ordering from this place now, simply because their delivery and food quality varies so wildly.

(2/5 simply because the pizza never disappointed, but it's not really worth the wait.)
author: Tony S.

description:
Hole in the Wall can hit the spot with a walk-in by the slice or a delivered wagon wheel if you. Red something to service a ravenous pack of drunk roomies. The bacon they throw on pizza is crisped perfectly and their Deep Fried Oreos bring out the inner fat kid in anyone.

The walk-in has four barstools and a bench outside, so you might have to stand if it's a busy drinking night in the Marina.
author: Michael S.

description: Pepperoni pizza. Super good. Giant slices. 2 for $7! Place is literally a hole in the wall. No bathroom, but you can use the one at the bar across the street. 4 seats in the place and at night they put out a folding table.
author: Lisa T.

description: Came in from out of town. Wanted to grab something quick. The name does the place justice. It's definitely a small hole in the wall. We weren't expecting much, but let me tell you. This food was PHENOMENAL. I ordered the cheeseburger and it was huge, juicy, and honestly one of the best burgers I've had in my life and I was not expecting this to be the case since it is a pizza place. And not only that but the prices were so reasonable! This has to be the best kept secret in SF. Would highly recommend to anyone and everyone.
author: Dana L.

description: Delicious pizza and very friendly delivery driver! My family had the Hawaiian with bacon and jalapeños pizza, the Margarita pizza and a pepperoni pizza, all very good. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who is craving good quality pizza!
author: erica w.

description:
I happened to walk by Hole in The Wall Pizza and stopped in my tracks by the smell wafting out the front door. It was only 11:15am, but my stomach told me it was lunch time.

I ended up with a slice of the "Hangover" - Bacon, Jalapenos, Pineapple... delicious. The crust was crisp, had a nice amount of chew, and the toppings were great. The best part to me was the red sauce - savory, bright, and not sweet (too many tomato sauces are sweet!!). 

To top it off, the guy working the counter insisted I take a free beverage for the road. Nice touch.

Cheers!
author: Andreas H.

description: OMG!  LOOOOOVE this pizza.  Everyone is super freakin' nice, even at 2am.  Never fails us and always greets with a smile. Try their pizza, garlic knots, or boneless buffalo wings for the best cheat day ever.
author: Andy S.

description:
There's some charm to it actually living up to its name (being a hole in a wall) and in place itself generally operating much like a hole in the wall NYC pizza place. The problem is that the pizza itself is pretty average. It's New York style, but the cheese doesn't taste particularly great and nothing about the pizza brings to mind "truly delicious" when you eat it.

Don't get me wrong, the pizza here isn't bad, but unless you're in a situation like us (nowhere else was open near the movie theater) there's basically no reason to come here.
author: Alex Z.

description: This pizza is great, but the best part is that they are open late to satisfy your late drunk hunger needs!
author: Anthony C.

description:
The veggie burger is DELICIOUS here! Boyfriend also got the cheeseburger and liked it.
Fries are also delicious. Small little place, but lots of flavour!
author: Valeriya D.

description: Seriously! Where is my pizza!! I ordered almost 2 hours ago!! Don't lie to people, give a realistic  quote!
author: Colleen N.

description: More of a 3.5 but can't choose that. Judging solely based on how it compares to a New York slice. Dough was perforated and had a harder texture than normal. Cheese and sauce were ok but not tangy enough overall. Definitely not a bad slice especially for sf
author: Jeff L.

description: They are a part of the 5 star app but they don't honor the deals you rack up for being a repeat customer. I went in to redeem my reward. I bought one chicken pesto slice and was supposed to get one free. Cashier charged me for 2 slices which came out to over $7. I reminded her I had a reward and she gave me back $6. so did I really buy one slice and get one free? No, I didn't.
author: Christine A.

description:
Only reviewing for my 3 previous delivery orders, never been to the restaurant. 
Got a regular pizza with artichoke hearts and mushrooms and was delighted by how fresh and delicious the ingredients were! Definitely better than any Domino's or papa johns I've had. 
You MUST try the homemade ranch sauce, it's a perfect tangy addition to the warm and cheesy pie. 
Price is a little more than I would usually want to pay, but hey, you're paying for quality. 
This will be my go-to pizza joint for delivery for now on
author: Robin B.

description: Had delivery twice. There food is pretty freaking good and the delivery guy is really nice. Def good food for a Netflix and chill.
author: Corina R.

description: The food is just OK - nothing to write home about. However, the delivery was fast, our order was correct and the delivery driver was nice.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Let me start by saying this: I literally live next to Amici's, Marina Pizza is across the street, Paxti's is one block away, Delarosa is one block away, Pizza Orgasmica is two blocks away, and Extreme Pizza is a close walk, and yet I still regularly choose SF Hole In The Wall over all of these other nearby competitors (and yes, I've tried all of them). Why?

1. They have great customer service. I'll just give one recent example. I was there earlier today ordering pizza and fried Oreos. After getting the pizza box, I left, forgetting about the Oreos. After getting home, I realized I'd left them and called to ask if I could just get a refund or if I should go back and pick them up. I started out with, "Hi, I was just in there 15 minutes ago and ordered takeout, and I think I left the fried Oreos...." The owner immediately remembered me and said, "Yes, they're here. Do you live close by, and do you want us to bring them to you?" I was pleasantly surprised (since it was 7:45 p.m. on a Saturday night, a busy time for them) and said, "Umm, sure...? [Gave him my address.] But no rush, seriously--thanks!" Literally six (6) minutes later, they were at my apartment with the Oreos. So nice!!!

2. Their delivery is fast (always ahead of schedule, never had a late delivery), and the orders are accurate. I usually order their food through Eat24, and they also have some good deals/coupons available on there. Delivery is also free, no added charges.

3. The food is good, and I like the menu. You can get a custom-made pizza, or they also have some good specialty pizzas. You can also order by the slice (in-person as well as delivery, which not all pizza places do). In addition to pizza, they have a bunch of other great items--my favorites are the wings (love that they offer boneless wings!), chicken sandwiches, and fried Oreos. Oh, and let's not forget the homemade ranch sauce!

4. Prices are totally reasonable and competitive. And, as mentioned above, they also offer coupons/deals. Delivery is free.

5. They truly are a small hole in the wall, mom and pop shop. I think I've seen the owner in there working every time I've been there. It's a small restaurant, not much seating, but it's cozy and has character (including cool pics on the wall and a toy train). They're somewhat of a hidden gem in my opinion, and I was so happy when I first discovered them a few years ago. So next time when you get out of the bars in the Triangle and nearby Pizza Orgasmica has its usual line of 50 people waiting for their late-night drunken slice of pizza, consider walking a few blocks over to SF Hole In The Wall, and I think you'll be glad that you did!
author: Christina Y.

description: We were looking for good, reasonable prices take-out to eat at the beach. Pizza was super delicious, service was quick and friendly! We had the pizza San Francisco and the garlic cheese bread and within 12 minutes it was made fresh for us. Would definitely go back.
author: Nicole B.

description: Super delicious pizza and their buffalo wings are amazing! Very reasonable price. The staff was super friendly. We stopped by late at night and it took them about 10 minutes to have it ready. Will definitely be back next time we are in San Fran.
author: Leyvi R.

description:
Great pizza 
Professional treatment.. Small store comfy and cozy! 
The train in the store is the best part! 
I highly recommend SF hole in the wall pizza
author: Abed M.

description: Quick with good service. Good spot to grab a slice for a few bucks. Place looks and smells clean every time I come in. The lady up front is quick and always nick and remembers your normal orders after comming only a few times
author: Alonzo T.

description: Cool little spot for pizza on the go or a slice while you sit. Small joint but the pesto pizza was totally delicious!
author: Jackie R.

description:
Coming from a New Yorker who now lives in San francisco... Pizza isn't bad. 

5 thumbs DOWN? 6+ dollars for a dozen garlic knots. No way! Thats robbery.

Price is too high for pizza, spend your money somewhere nice around the corner or something.
author: Bea A.

description:
I love pizza, I even make my own pizza since I love pizza so much (hand made dough and all). But sometimes, making your own pizza is tedious and sometimes you just want it right away. With that being said: 

This pizza was amazing; I love the dough especially. I had a garlic pesto slice and it was great! I enjoyed every single bite of it. Will definitely come here more often and luckily they have delivery since I live nearby! 

Definitely will recommend.
author: Robbie P.

description: A neighborhood staple.  My favorite pizza that I can always grab quick.  Late night, Hole in the Wall Pizza is a Diamond in the Rough.  Delicious!
author: Gary B.

description: Right before heading back to LA we had to stop by. First timers & we def. give this place a thumbs up! If you love nice n crispy crust & a genuine pizza taste then this is the place. Lovely staff too.
author: Lily M.

description: Delicious pizza by the slice! The place looks a little sketchy but it's definitely worth it! Only 4 seats inside so be prepared to take it to go.
author: Ruth R.

description:
Late night cravings for food????? Stop at this joint and try their tasty pizzas. 
Cheap, fast and good service. Will definitely satisfy your hunger at 2 am!!!
author: Claudine V.

description: Outstanding Pizza...we are vacationing from Arizona and it is better than any Pizza you can get in Phoenix.
author: Sheri B.

description:
One of the BEST pizza places in the Bay Area! Fast delivery and good customer service every time. Whenever I call them, I love that they just verify my address since my info is already in their system! Lol Then, they send us a coupon for 3 toppings large pizza with a pound of chicken wings for only $25.99! Such a deal! However, don't expect their chicken wings to be the traditional one, they look like nuggets and their BBQ sauce is amazing! My boyfriend loves their Chicken Pesto pizza but I actually prefer to pick my own toppings! Lol

Will definitely recommend this place to visit if you're in the area. They are literally a "hole in the wall" :)
author: Mia O.

description: If you want super mediocre pizza then this is your spot. The pizza is all cheese (subpar cheese) and no sauce. It befuddles me that it has 4 stars at the time of this review. Standards, people.
author: Chris H.

description:
After a night out with friends and having the drunk munchies I came across this place as it was the few places still open late night and I so happened to make it as they were about to close.  

They were out of slices and weren't about to make another pie which is understandable.  My buddy and I decided to split a medium pie which ended up being DELICIOUS!! I don't know if it was because I was drunk but I definitely enjoyed it enough to want to write a review the next day.

Only thing I could negative which isn't really that much of a negative would be the prices (in my opinion) are a bit high for the type of place it is.  But then again it is San Fran and everything is expensive.  Do I regret buying the pizza??? No, not at all.  Would I do it again?? Definitely!!

Thank you for the much needed yummyness!!
author: Sammy Z.

description:
this pizza is amazing! im originally from buffalo NY so although our pizza is different from NYC style I can still recognize delicious pizza. not many places on the West Coast can send me head over heels about a slice of pizza but Hole In the Wall has done just that. 

oh and by the way, just get the ranch dressing. it is heavenly!!
author: Chris M.

description:
I really really want to like this place since it's the only place close to my house that you can buy pizza by the slice. But just like the other reviewers I have found that every time there is very little marinara sauce and what is on there lacks any flavor. Service has always been great and the crust is thin and crispy but to have a good pizza the sauce needs to great as well. 
I guess I will just have to continue to walk to Union street for a great slice of pizza.
author: Tim L.

description: This pizza is great for late night munchies! The bottom crust is crispy just how I like it. My boyfriend and I always order this after the club. It also makes for great hang over breakfast!
author: May C.

description:
Don't try ordering things off the menu from yelp, half the food on yelp isn't offered... Frustrated because their menu says bacon cheese fries and I just called and they don't understand what I'm talking about.  When I explained to them what it is he kept asking me if I wanted garlic. So I just ordered regul  I had someone call back and turns out the guy didn't even take the fries I had ordered.   

If you want a cheap pizza and don't care about the service you get, this place is for you.
author: Acilegna T.

description: We only get pizza by the slice here, we love it. It's always been consistent with a great crispy crust, and the perfect amount of cheese and sauce. Whenever we're in town this is usually a late night stop since its within walking distance from us and they're open late, lucky for us they're yummy too.
author: Sandy C.

description: Was browsing for something cheap and within walking distance from the hotel and stumbled across this place. Literally a hole in the wall. Cheap prices and fast service. The cashier whom I'm assuming is the manager went out of his way to make me a fresh slice with a few extra minutes of wait time. Delicious!
author: Cory N.

description: Arravied late to San Francisco and was craving for some pizza. This place had the best reviews for the area I was in and now I know why. IT'S GREAT! We had an XL pepperoni, mushroom, and extra cheese and it was delicious. Crust had excellent flavor and baked just right. Toppings tasted fresh and flavorful, especially the mushrooms. It was also delivered in under 30 min on a Thursday night and arrived hot. So hot that we had to wait a few min so it can cool down enough to eat without the toppings slipping off. Definitely recommend this place. I can't wait to order something else next time I'm in the mood for pizza. =D
author: Eddie V.

description: Really enjoyable pizza. Very close to NY style. The crust is a bit thicker than most NY pizzas. However, the crust is burnt almost spot on. The pepperoni has generous cheese and just the right amount of pepperoni.  It's truly a hole in the wall there are 4 seats at the bar on a wall as you walk in. Don't walk by this place!
author: A W.

description: My absolute favorite pizza place. Order from here all the time and it's always great and the pizza is fresh
author: Razan N.

description:
Where else can you get a slice of pizza  that is cheap and good with a good crust for $3?  The toppings are generous especially when it comes to fresh tomatoes.  I like the sweet potato fries more than the garlic bread.  Most people order take-out, but it's better to eat it before the crust gets soggy.    

Service is fast and friendly.  Free wifi and TV to watch while you eat on the small counter.  Parking can be tough on the streets, but there are nearby paid lots.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Not bad for a little hoke in the wall.

5 stars for fast delivery
3 stars for the pizza

At the moment, I'm eating my first pizza from Hole In The Wall.  Not bad.  I'll definitely order again and try something other than the Vegetarian.  The pizza was good but it could have been much tastier if they had been more generous with the sauce.   There was only a teeny weenie amount of sauce.  I wasn't sure it was there until I poked around and found a little pink spot on the dough.
author: Donna P.

description: This place is great !!!!! I love LOVE LOVE the pizza !!! It has to be my favorite pizza so far. The staff here are nice a friendly. YOU CAN CHARGE YOUR PHONE !!! I walked into this place because I was so hungry and desperate for food after work and I'm glad this is going to be my go to place after work now !!
author: Giselle J.

description:
One night while visiting from LA, my friends took me out to the Marina for a night of bar hopping after dinner. After last call we all headed to this place for some snacks. 

The pizza slices were pretty decent, but my disease of ordering the wrong thing at places hit hard when I got the bacon cheese fries. It took at least 15 minutes to make and just was ew. So learn from my mistake, stick to pizza at a place that has pizza in its name. Duh.
author: Roxanne G.

description: I thought the pizza wasn't bad. Thin crust New York style pizza which is what I like in a pizza. The sauce was a little off. I couldn't pinpoint what it was about it. I ordered a side of fries which I enjoyed. I really liked that they salted them since a lot of places don't. I probably would go back if I were in the area maybe try something different on my pizza.
author: Heather L.

description: This place has the BEST pizza I've had so far in SF. Absolutely amazing. And the guy at the counter is so nice! I was talking to him about how I had never been in before and he gave me a free house ranch to try! And the ranch was absolutely amazing! Definitely going to start coming here more often. And they're open late!
author: Anna M.

description:
This is hands down my go-to place whenever I want delicious pizza. Once all the bars are closed on the Marina, this place is still open welcoming me with delicious gooey pizza goodness. Prices are reasonable and way more delicious than Pizza Orgasmica. They have slices ready to eat and they are always switching out the flavors available so it doesn't get boring with the same thing everyday. 

They also have deep fried Oreos and buffalo wings! Now if that isn't munchy food I dont know what is. 

Lastly, the owner is so wonderful! You can tell he really cares about the restaurant. He is almost always there and attentive to detail and guest satisfaction.
author: Damaris M.

description:
Its unfair to write about pizza in Cali when your from NYC.  But Im going to do it anyway.  

I was a few doors down and I had a few glasses of wine and of course everything has been closed when I just started to get hungery.  My friend suggested this place to get a few slices because it was too late.  Well beggars cant be choosers.  So I decided to get two slices.  As I opened the box to eat my slices.  I find a small container of some sauce.  I was bewildered and discovered it was ranch sauce.  I heard it was Cali deal.  Not sure if it was true or not.  I dipped my pizza into the sauce.  Meh not bad.  The pizza wasn't too bad wasn't too great either.  It filled its purpose.  I think the ranch made it taste better.  But I won't go that route again.
author: A K.

description: So far, my favorite pizza joint in SF. Ask for thick crust & well done...you won't regret it!
author: Josh W.

description:
Formerly Irving Pizza.   Same owners.   Same great pizza.   Totally new look and menu selection.   Everything in there is brand new and modern (there's even a model train around the ceiling).   This is the only place in the Marina to grab a "slice."  Also helps that it's reasonably priced and a down-to-earth establishment.  Though, they no longer have their 2 slices and a beer for $6 special anymore.

If you're looking for more reviews, search for the old Irving Pizza listing at the same address.
author: Derek L.

description:
The staff was not inviting. The pizza was not great. The price was a bit much. 2 slices of pizza was just short of $10. 

Eh.
author: Michael A.

description: delivery guy forgot salad but was quick to go back to retrieve it. pizza was as described
author: Sandy S.

description: I really love this place. They always deliver quickly, always get my order right and their vegetarian pizza is delicious. They also deliver later than anywhere else in the Marina area. All the best things!
author: Marisa L.

description: Ok so pizzas never showed up! They apparently can't give a realistic quote. 2 hours have passed no pizza!
author: Saina E.

description: Pizza never showed up! I hope you're not hungry because you're not gonna get your food. They claim you'll get it in 40 min...nope, it's an hour and half and nothing!
author: Shervin K.

description:
It really is a Hole in the Wall place. Came here with a group of 5 after flying kites at Fort Mason and we took over the place..private party babaayy

FOOD:
Ordered a large half combo classic, half veggie. 10 slices. $25. It was alright, I mean just as you would expect a pizza to taste with those toppings on it, but nothing out of this world.

+We added the buffalo wings for an extra $3 and they were NOT GOOD!! They weren't wings. Just friend chicken nuggets with ranch and a untasty sauce.

SERVICE:
The guys was nice, took about 20 minutes to get the pizza to us though.

AMBIENCE: 
hole in the wall. would be great for a late night though and a nice alternative to the always -packed Pizza Orgasmic up the street.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
So, stumbling out of a bar, I see a glowing sign that says "pizza by the slice." I'm fairly inebriated, and pizza sounds freaking delicious, so I tell my friends to wait for me while I get me some pizza action. One guy was working..Asian dude. Super nice, and more than willing to strike up a conversation with a drunk.

I get my pizza, and begin the walk to nowhere. My super hero of a friend decides to falcon punch the ever living shit out of my pizza, sending it and all it's glory down to the street. My friend, feeling super guilty runs over back to the hole to get me another pizza. You guys were willing to hook me up with another slice on the house. That is freaking cool. My friend insists she pay for it, and we go on our merry way. 

Here's what is so freaking awesome about all this: the pizza is effing delicious!! The combo had all sorts of good things in it, and it wasn't too greasy or too dry. I cannot wait to hit this spot up again! Thanks for showing a SoCal kid love!!
author: Julian J.

description: Yelp deal! Dinner wasn't until 8:00 p.m. and it was 6:00 p.m., and needed a slice. Prices are okay, but with the yelp deal it was ever better.  Slices are a good portion. Fresh. Crusty bottom. Oozzy cheese. It was delicious.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Got our order within the given time. Pleasantly suprised by the amount and the quality off the food. The remarques we made were perfectly followed. Delivery guy was very friendly. Only reason why we didn't gave five stars is because the burgers were a bit overcooked. We would certainly order again if we were to live in the united states ;)
author: Tinny L.

description:
I don't know about you but "Hole in the Wall..." places are usually AWESOME... 95% of the time that is. :)

Whole in the Wall PIzza was awesome.  Their pizzas are YUMMI and their crust is nice and crispy.  Not too thick and not too thin... just perfect if you ask me.  Slices served were fair in size and they don't skimp on toppings either.

Service was pleasant and friendly... easy going staff with patience for the possible late night drunks from Republic.
author: Patricia G.

description: I am giving this place one star only because I can not give zero stars. Is the food good, absolutely, but I am rating their service! Last Sunday I called to order a pizza. I was going to pick it up because it's only 3 blocks from my house. They quoted me 35 min, so, at 30 min my boyfriend headed down. Once he got there they told him it'd be 20 min longer. In not wanting to walk back home just to walk right back....my boyfriend ran an errand nearby. After 20 min, he went back only to then sit at the restaurant another 40 min!! So now we are looking at a 90min pizza!!!! Are you kidding me? I mean, I've waited 90 min for a delivered one before, but when quoted 35 min and then have to wait an additional hour?!?! Ridiculous! Then no one offered a discount or hell, a free pizza at that point would have been nice! I am in the profession of customer service and if my staff or establishment took this long I would have comped the whole thing. Either way...TERRIBLE! Food good, but it better be after waiting an hour and a half for it!
author: Nicole G.

description:
I'm hopeful that I might be able to move this up to four stars next time around.

It took about an hour fifteen to get my pizza--but it's the World Series so I'm totally cool with the delay. When it came the pie was nice and hot.

The main issue I had is with the sauce-to-cheese ratio. Not quite enough sauce, so you end up getting what is essentially a cheese pie with a little sauce.

Californians may not mind this, but I also think the crust is just on the border of too thick for "New York Style" pizza. Granted--it's still thinner than many crusts you'll see, and much thicker than Amici's which is a good thing. But it's almost a bit too much.

I asked for half pesto on my pie and they nailed it--good mix, good pop to the pesto, nicely done.

The price is also pretty good. Maybe a buck or two more than the no-name pizza places, but much cheaper than Amici's or some of the (good) designer ones like Pizza Orgasmica.

I'll be sure to update when I give these guys another shot next month.
author: Paul C.

description: Incredibly fast, fresh pizza. Love the sauce. Big big pizzas. Don't make the mistake I did and order a large. It's huge!!!  Great find, this place.
author: Samantha Y.

description: It was a cold day. Many of the restaurants in this neighborhood weren't serving dinner yet. I was chilly, hungry, and a bit grumpy. I step into Hole it the Wall Pizza and I'm immediately greeted by a friendly staff. I had a delicious hot slice, an equally delicious cold beer, and left very happy. Definitely going to start making excuses to end up in the Marina so I can stop by Hole in the Wall.
author: Ben H.

description: BOMB.com I've only been here after some serious shenanigans and it has been awesome every single time. If I was in that area more often during the week I'd probably swing by a lot more. The slices are awesome and I had the calzone once and it was good. It is also open late, barely any seating inside so be prepared to eat outside and also be prepared for a possible wait when the bars let out although the wait is really never that long, they process the lines pretty quickly.
author: Kris D.

description:
"Cheese" like rubber. It'll probably stay in my intestines for years.

Outta time and hungry, I took a chance. Precooked slice shops will never have the best of course, but Escape from NY and even Blondies, and of course Tony's in NB all can fix a craving. But this barely tasted like food.
author: Brian C.

description:
GREAT pizza for its price.
African-American lady was very nice in explaining deals and suggesting good combination of toppings. 
Lunch deal - 1 slice+ 1 drink 3.99, 2slice +drink - 7.99

Combo pizza is little greasy though. 
Toppings are added in generous portions. 
Dough is perfect- chewy and moist. 
I eat alot as a girl but 2 slice was ALOT. Recommend just one, a GOOD one. 
Definitely again. :) 

Has soap drama on, while there were 12 yrs old, 7yrs old kids in the store. WHAT?! 
Dont bring your kids. 
Dont plan to dine in. Take out.
author: Jinn C.

description: Ham calzone was delicious. The mixture of fresh mozzarella and ricotta in the calzones was so creamy, it was a tasty treat on its own. The meat lovers pizza with mozzarella was some of the best I have had. Meats were savory, but not overly salty as some curd meats can be. This is really a small place, but it has a personality bursting from within. The Smurf train up near the ceiling was cute. Lots of photos of Robin Williams, charging dongles for your phones are available wile you wait or while you eat.
author: Jon H.

description: Delicious pizza in the Marina and in a great location for those in need of a late night snack after consuming adult beverages in the 94123.  If you're looking for a crispy crust and large slices this is your place.  Personal favorites include pepperoni and the supreme.
author: Allie Y.

description: Love their pizza! Perfect crust, lots of toppings, and reasonably priced. Nice people also. This is now our go-to pizza for delivery!
author: Marianne W.

description: Called to order a pizza for delivery was told by Angela it would be about 45 minutes. An hour and 20 minutes goes by I call back to see where the pizza is. Angela said another 10 -12 minutes. Another 15 minutes goes by and no delivery. I am now calling another place to delivery and because of this experience will not use them ever again.
author: Julie W.

description:
I really liked this place! I thought the customer service was great and I just got great vibes from this place. 

Prices were alright, I ordered a 3 topping medium pizza and was charged $24, but luckily it cost that much because the girl rang in a large pizza. I was on vacation so I didn't mind being a glutton ;-) Not that I would have minded eating a large pizza if I weren't on vacation...

I thought the pizza was yummy but if I could recommend anything, I would ask the manager to allow for a little bit more toppings.. I felt like my pepperonis, pineapple, and jalapenos were a little few and far between. 

If I am lucky enough to come back, I'll remember to order my pizza with extra sauce. I love pizza sauce!
author: Elizabeth B.

description: On a recent five-day trip, we ate here three times. Best pizza I've had outside Brooklyn, and compares to anything I ever had there. I don't normally post reviews,  but this place deserves one.
author: Gene M.

description: Came on a Friday night with friends. Limited options. No veggie pizza (not even cheese). Maybe I'm spoiled but ive come to expectt at least one non-meat option at most places - even if it's just sides.
author: Kathryn H.

description: I've ordered twice and both times was perfect! I've eaten my share of Italian pizza and west coast pizza and this pizza is legit for a movie night at home :)
author: Sara C.

description:
I love this place, quick and easy place to get a slice of great pizza!  Hole in the Wall Pizza is near Scott and Lombard, and you can buy slices of cheese, pepperoni, combination and sometimes sausage.  The cheese is thick, the crust is thick but crunchy, and you can be in and out the door with a meal in your hand in under 3 minutes and about 3 bucks. Whole pizzas run about $20-$25.

The owner has always been inside the store whenever I've gone, working behind the counter or working on his Macbook.  He and his staff are always friendly, service is always quick, and the store is *very* clean.  

There really isn't any place to sit except one small table, this place is grab and go.

Beer prices are crazyyyyy though for a place you're just going to walk out of!  $5 for a bottle, $25 for a 6 pack. Premium beers run $6 a bottle, $30 a 6 pack.
author: Mailah G.

description:
Big thank you to the staff a Hole in the Wall Pizza! I lost my phone last night and stopped in this morning while retracing my steps. Unfortunately my phone was not there but they were super helpful - they even called the person that worked the shift I was there to see if my phone had been found. Very kind. Thanks again

(and yes I found my phone)
author: Kelly F.

description: I was a good customer but never more. I ordered my pizza at 8 pm with Eat24  scheduled for pick up at 10:30. What could go wrong? 10 minutes later I get a call from Eat24 saying that the restaurant has to charge me extra for who knows wha. It was an $8 difference so I said ok. Then at 9pm get a call from the restaurant saying that my pizza is ready and has been sitting waiting for an hour. How can it be sitting for an hour if it's scheduled for 10:25? The rude guy on the phone said he doesn't know and blamed some fax for it saying that it nowhere says 10:25. Well, I have my receipt, you douche. When my husband came to pick it up they gave him a hard time as well and didn't give him the second item that I ordered until he mentioned it. Both of the guys who were there were very rude about him coming at 10:30pm to pick it up and mentioned to him that they close at 11pm. Even said that our pizza would be tossed in the garbage if he'd come any later. It says you are open till 11pm. It doesn't say anywhere that you can close at 10:30pm and now I have to deal with your BS attitude.  How freakin professional and welcoming.  So we finally got our overcharged cold pizza and a crappy attitude I don't need from a couple of nasty, rude people who don't give a crap about customer service. I will tell all my friends a coworkers from the neighborhood to AVOID this place that doesn't appreciate getting any business.
author: Laurie P.

description: Love pizza but not eating it these days.  Was hungry at 2:30 a.m. & caught their menu on Yelp!  Stopped in & ordered the 4 Meatball appetizer in Marinara sauce with Mozzarella cheese to go.  Hot with 4 nice size meatballs. Admit I was afraid they'd be small & not worth it. Definitely worth $7.00!  Very friendly service.  Gooey & Delicious. Sprinkled some parm on it.  Hmm...
author: Joshua C.

description: Pizza quality is dependable and consistently good. What really make this place great is that they sell single slices of pizza. Most of the time they have 4-5 different types of pizza ready to go for the single slices. The bbq is good as is the pepperoni. Nothing too spectacular about the pizza, just convenient!
author: George S.

description: Tasteless. Canned olives. Crust was good.
author: Josh F.

description:
Awesome! Quick service, delicious pizza!

I recommend the Combo because it filled me up. SO MUCH TOPPINGS!

Friendly service, great taste in music. While I ate by my lonesome after work, I enjoyed hearing Coldplay as I munched down my pizza.

Overall: EAT HERE! Especially if you're in the Marina and on a budget. $2-4 a slice of pizza that will fill you up!
author: Patricia D.

description: Wow, just had such a horrible experience the other day. I don't know her name, but there is a cashier with the worst customer service "skills" ever. She quoted us 10-12 minutes for 3 slices of pizza, but we ended up waiting 22-25 minutes. That wouldn't have been so bad if we haven't gotten 2 of the 3 first, then watch as the pre-sliced pizza sit in the window while she fumble around, almost trying to look busy (at this point we just wanted to take a slice and go) but no, she ACTUALLY served another customer in front of us who had just walked in from off the street and didn't wait at all, with the exact same pizza we had requested. Who does that? We had been waiting so long, double the time she quoted us, and they hadn't waited at all. Why give the exact kind of pizza we ordered and paid for to someone who literally just walked in?? Very rude, we were definitely really frustrated by the experience, not to mention the pizza was even burnt at the bottom. Ugh. I've actually had good service here before, which is why the review isn't one star, but that girl needs to be fired. I've worked in pizza restaurants before, it isn't that hard and even when you think you're busy (it wasn't that busy when we went) keeping calm and doing things in order is the way to ensure happy customers.
author: Brady G.

description: Only 2 stars for getting the order wrong and responding with poor customer service.  Ordered a calzone, salad, and boneless wings.  Calzone and wings were good.  The salad did not come as ordered.  They forgot 2/4 ingredients.  When we called back to explain what happened, they didn't seem to care,  and gave us $2 off our next order, so that they could get off the phone.  Your not winning anyone over with poor customer service and certainly not with a  $2 discount off our NEXT order.  Don't hold your breath for that one.
author: Patrick M.

description: So good! This is the best pizza I've had anywhere outside of my hometown, NY. The service was extremely friendly and much more than what you'd expect at a casual pizza place. Can't wait to come back!
author: Sarah R.

description: Ok so my mom & I are visiting from Hawaii (which isn't exactly the pizza capital of the world). We flew in pretty late & decided to walk around the corner of our motel to look for a food joint still open. Came across this place & decided to try it out. Ordered a medium pizza with half chicken pesto & half artichoke bacon. Added on a spinach calzone for the hell of it (menu says its their mothers recipe.. cant go wrong). In all honesty, the service was good & owner/employee was a really cool guy. Only thing was.. the wait. It was a bit longer than I anticipated, so if you're in a rush.. don't bother coming here. The owner came out to apologize about the wait a couple times, but we didn't mind too much. But if you're willing to wait for quality food that was well worth it, please do. I definitely would suggest this place to anyone & will be bragging about it to my friends back home. My first bite into my pizza, I was pretty mindblown. The ingredients tasted fresh & the dough was perfect. I usually don't eat the crust, but damn it was good. And the calzone.. holy f'n hell.. seriously I've never had a calzone like that. It was stuffed! Just filled with fresh spinach, garlic, cheese & red onions, OMG. So simple, but so damn delish! My mom and I were more than impressed & pleased with what we've ordered. You can tell they definitely take pride in their work & I'm very glad we just so happened to stumble upon this gem. We don't have the luxury of experiencing quality/authentic new york style pizza like this, so it was literally the best we've had by far! & to top it off, we just ate our leftovers for lunch today (after 4 days of sitting in the fridge) & everything was still awesome. The dough wasn't even rubbery! My mom mentioned after she finished her leftoevers, "now that's what you call pizza." Can't argue with that.
author: Erica S.

description: I've always had a good experience here. If anything has been wrong they always fix it for you. Delivery is super fast in the marina every time I've called. Best pizza in the marina that I've found having lived here for about a year now.
author: Andrew G.

description: Buy it by the slice and you get a HUGE slice. Everything on top, fresh and hot. Very good value for what you get, especially with in the Bay Area where everything is expensive. If you need a quick, inexpensive meal, this is a great place to stop by.
author: Willie W.

description: Won't order delivery from here again. I wish I was able to comment on the pizza... but because my pizza was never delivered to me, this rating is based solely on their customer service. We called at 2 am last night for pizza through GrubHub. It said the order went through and that it should arrive by 2:45 am. 2:45 passed and the pizza wasn't delivered. We called, they confirmed my order and said the delivery person should be there any minute. I called again at 2:55, because they were closing in 5 minutes and the delivery person still hadn't shown up. Again, they told us that the delivery person should be there any minute. The delivery person never showed up. We called the after hours number and the man on the opposite line said he'd check on it. There was no response, so I called again and he said that he's half asleep and he'll check on the order when he gets into work at 11 the next day. Really upset and disappointed with the way they handled their service. They shouldn't of lied to us three times about the status of our order. If they weren't able to deliver the food, they shouldn't of accepted the order and my payment. I'm currently in the process of getting a refund through GrubHub. Also, we live in the Marina so it shouldn't of taken that long to prepare the food and deliver it...
author: Hana K.

description: Great pizza, awesome and affordable prices! Definitely a good idea for late night food
author: Heather Y.

description: Okay... So there is so much hype about the best pizza here in the city and I've tried them all. That was until I came here. Everyone loves a "hole in the wall" joint (pun intended)! If you can appreciate friendly staff and great customer service over a slice of pizza and beer, then this is your place! Love it!
author: David W.

description:
ordered delivery from hole in the wall pizza last night - definitely not a good experience. gave the order, address, everything fine - 45/50mins for delivery time - no problem. 45mins goes by... an hour goes by... hour 15mins goes by... call the place and am told that the driver called me and no one answered. i have no missed calls and when the driver returned to the shop, they didn't think to call me. strange. i confirm the address and my cell number - guy says they'll send out for delivery again. 10mins...15mins...30mins goes by - nothing. call the shop again - says the guy is out for delivery - but i have no missed calls and see no one. no offer for partial refund or replacement for what is now 2 hours old cold food - nothing. 

i send my husband out and he flags down a delivery driver - who turns out to be the guy with our food - had my name wrong and the address - and must have had the phone number wrong too because he never called to ask for directions. 

bad service all the way around - 2 hour long delivery after being quoted less than an hour - cold food - poor customer service. 

needless to say - i'll be ordering from pizza orgasmica next time - and likely never from hole in the wall again.
author: Quinn N.

description: Best pizza I have had in a long time. Deep fried Oreos are no joke either. Two slices and a beer for easy $.
author: Michael M.

description:
If you are in the Marina and need something fast - this is about your only option. Pizza slices are always available and you can be in and out within 3 minutes. However, quality is lacking in their pizza. 

Crust is chewy and bland, cheese is thick and rubbery. Topping selection is average.

Fine for late night snack and drunken cravings.

Best part of the Hole In the Wall Pizza is the train that runs around the shop.
author: Abra A.

description: For just a hole in the wall, and I really do mean "a hole in the wall", the pizza slices are the yummiest and it's not just because it's 2'o'clock in the morning after the bars. There's something about the dough. This is the closest to NY style pizza in San Francisco that's fast & convenient. And I like that it's kind of hidden, it never gets too crowded for such a small space.
author: Jules F.

description:
I ordered a large pizza for delivery (pepperoni, mushroom, onion). It was delivered relatively quickly and the driver was friendly. The online ordering worked well; there was an option to get a txt message/email when the pizza was out for delivery.

I didn't like the pizza though. The crust was bland, it was too greasy, and the pepperoni didn't have a great flavor. I planned to have extra for leftovers but I'm actually throwing away most of the pizza.

I don't plan to try again, but at least they were open late.
author: E S.

description: I ordered a slice of cheese pizza and the crust was perfect, however, there was absolutely no taste to the actual pizza. The cheese and very thing layer of tomato sauce had no flavor.
author: Karrie F.

description: Love this place.  Big fan of the cheese pizzas, and they always accommodate our parties for delivery.  The Crust is tasty ( a must ) and fast delivery.  Inside, it's eclectic decor... trains, movie stars, etc., and something on the big screen to while away the moments of fresh, hot bites of goodness.
author: UnitedStudios S.

description: Fav late night slice place. Never too long of a line. Really good fresh pie
author: Dominic N.

description: I'm sorry, but the pizza was not great for me. And I have had my fair share of slices in my life to know. My staple slice is pepperoni with mushrooms, I inconveniently came her to grab a slice because my daughter's swim class is nearby. So I thought I grab a quick bite before so. My slice of pepperoni and mushroom was not even on the agenda when I ordered it, they had to make it. Not only it took like 7 or so minutes, when I received my slice of pizza the mushrooms were not even real mushrooms, it's that dry paper like mushrooms. Which felt like I was eating nothing, but weird nothing (if that makes any sense). I manage to shove down 3/4 of the slice because I haven't eaten all day and I starving. No bueno *smh
author: Eva H.

description: Love it!!! Great pizza, ok price, nice people. Great place to go after hitting the bars or if you want calzone. I give them props for dealing with drunk fools all night. No complaints! Yummy!
author: M B.

description: I would be more inclined to give this place a better rating if it was cheaper because their pepperoni is beef, but it's not really that good and it's the same price as Patxi's. That makes no sense to me.
author: mazzy s.

description: I had always been a fan of Irving Pizza but this new place that took over the location is just awful. I felt nauseous after eating the first slice. It's also more expensive for a less tasty pizza pie. Definitely a thumbs down.
author: Lisi G.
